text: Do not envy men of evil,
and do not desire to be with them.
For their minds will devise violence,
and their lips will speak mischief.
By wisdom a house is built,
and by understanding it is established.
And by knowledge, rooms are filled
\add with\add* all riches, precious and pleasant.
The warrior of wisdom \add is\add* in strength,
and a man of knowledge is strong \add in\add* power.
For with wise guidance you shall make war for yourself,
and victory \add is\add* in an abundance of counsel.
Wisdom \add is too\add* high for fools;
at the gate he will not open his mouth.
He who plans to do evil for\f + \fr 24:8 \ft Or “to” \f* himself,
they will call \add him\add* “master\f + \fr 24:8 \ft Or “owner” \f* of mischief.”
Devising folly \add is\add* a sin,
and an abomination to humankind \add is\add* a scoffer.
\add If\add* you faint on the day of adversity,
little \add is\add* your strength.
Rescue those who are led away to the death
and those who stagger to the slaughter. If you hold back,
if you say, “Look, we do not know this,”
does not he who weighs hearts perceive \add it\add*?
And he who keeps your soul,\f + \fr 24:12 \ft Or “life,” or “inner self” \f*
he knows and will repay humankind according to his deeds.
My child, eat honey, for \add it is\add* good,
and the dripping of the honeycomb \add is\add* sweet to your taste.
Thus know wisdom for \add the sake of\add* your soul,\f + \fr 24:14 \ft Or “life,” or “inner self” \f*
if you find \add it\add*, then there is a future,
and your hope will not be cut off.
Do not lie in wait \add like\add* an outlaw against the home of the righteous;
do not do violence \add to\add* his dwelling place.
For seven \add times\add* the righteous will fall, but he will rise,
but the wicked will be overthrown by calamity.
While your enemies are falling, do not rejoice;
when he trips himself, may your heart\f + \fr 24:17 \ft Or “mind” \f* not be glad
lest Yahweh see and \add it\add* be evil in his eyes,
and turn his anger away from him.
Do not fret because of the evildoers;
do not envy the wicked.
For there will not be a future for the evil;
the lamp of the wicked will die out.
Fear Yahweh, my son, and the king;
with those who change, do not associate.
For suddenly their disaster will come,
and the ruin of ⸤both of them⸥,\f + \fr 24:22 \ft Literally “\fq the \ft two of them” \f* who knows?
These \add sayings\add* are also for the wise:
⸤Partiality⸥\f + \fr 24:23 \ft Literally “acknowledge faces” \f* in judgment is not good.
Whoever says to the guilty, “You are righteous,” the people will curse him;
the nations will abhor him.
But they who rebuke will have delight,
and upon them blessings of goodness will come.
He will kiss \add the\add* lips,
he who gives an honest answer.
Prepare your work in the street and get it ready for yourself in the field;
afterward, then\f + \fr 24:27 \ft Hebrew “and” \f* you shall build your house.
Do not be a witness without cause against your neighbor
nor deceive with your lips.
Do not say, “Just as he has done to me, so shall I do to him;
I will pay back the man according to his deed.”
I passed by the field of a lazy person,
and over the vineyard of a person lacking ⸤sense⸥;\f + \fr 24:30 \ft Literally “heart” \f*
and behold, it was overgrown—all of it was covered \add with\add* thorns, its surface with nettles,
and ⸤its stone wall⸥\f + \fr 24:31 \ft Literally “a wall of his/its stones” \f* was broken down.
Then I myself saw and my heart\f + \fr 24:32 \ft Or “mind” \f* considered;
I looked, and I took hold of instruction:
A little sleep, a little slumber,
a little folding of the hands for rest,
and your poverty will come running,
and your lack like an armed warrior.
